title: A better Bayesian Lasso
text: zlasso(, b, c, logarithm); dlasso(x, , b, c, logarithm); plasso(q, , b, c); qlasso(p, , b, c); rlasso(n, , b, c); elasso(, b, c); vlasso(, b, c); mlasso(, b, c); MillsRatio(d)

title: A better Bayesian Lasso
text: Normalizing constant Z, probability density function, cumulative distribution function, quantile function, random generation Lasso distribution parameters , , . addition, Mills ratio, mean, variance Lasso distribution provided. X ~ Lasso(, b, c) density function : p(x;,b,c)=Z−1exp(−12ax2+bx−c|x|)p(x;,b,c) = Z^{-1} \exp\left(-\frac{1}{2} x^2 + bx - c|x| \right) x∈ℝx \\mathbb{R}, >0a > 0, b∈ℝb \\mathbb{R}, c>0c > 0, ZZ normalizing constant. details included CDF, quantile function, normalizing constant original documentation.

text: see can used fit Bayesian Lasso models see vignette.

title: The Lasso Distribution — LassoDistribution
text: Normalizing constant Z, probability density function, cumulative distribution function, quantile function, random generation Lasso distribution parameters , b, c. addition, Mills ratio, mean, variance Lasso distribution provided.

title: The Lasso Distribution — LassoDistribution
code: zlasso(a, b, c, logarithm) dlasso(x, a, b, c, logarithm) plasso(q, a, b, c) qlasso(p, a, b, c) rlasso(n, a, b, c) elasso(a, b, c) vlasso(a, b, c) mlasso(a, b, c) MillsRatio(d)

title: The Lasso Distribution — LassoDistribution
text: x, q Vector quantiles (vectorized). p Vector probabilities. Vector precision parameter must non-negative. b Vector set parameter. c Vector tuning parameter must non-negative values. n Number observations. logarithm Logical. TRUE, probabilities returned log scale. d scalar numeric value. Represents point Mills ratio evaluated.

title: The Lasso Distribution — LassoDistribution
text: zlasso: normalizing constant Z. dlasso: density function. plasso: cumulative distribution function. qlasso: quantile function. rlasso: random generation. elasso: expected value. vlasso: variance. mlasso: mode. MillsRatio: computes Mills ratio \((1 - \Phi(d)) / \phi(d)\) given scalar input.

title: The Lasso Distribution — LassoDistribution
text: \(X \sim \text{Lasso}(, b, c)\) density function : $$ p(x;,b,c) = Z^{-1} \exp\left(-\frac{1}{2} x^2 + bx - c|x| \right) $$ \(x \\mathbb{R}\), \(> 0\), \(b \\mathbb{R}\), \(c > 0\), \(Z\) normalizing constant. details included CDF, quantile function, normalizing constant original documentation.

title: The Lasso Distribution — LassoDistribution
code: a <- 2; b <- 1; c <- 3 x <- seq(-3, 3, length.out = 1000) plot(x, dlasso(x, a, b, c, logarithm = FALSE), type = 'l')   r <- rlasso(1000, a, b, c) hist(r, breaks = 50, probability = TRUE, col = "grey", border = "white") lines(x, dlasso(x, a, b, c, logarithm = FALSE), col = "blue")   plasso(0, a, b, c) #>           [,1] #> [1,] 0.3739435 qlasso(0.25, a, b, c) #>             [,1] #> [1,] -0.08945799 elasso(a, b, c) #> [1] 0.1218306 vlasso(a, b, c) #> [1] 0.1287739 mlasso(a, b, c) #>      [,1] #> [1,]    0  MillsRatio(2) #> [1] 0.4213692  # The Modified_Hans_Gibbs() function uses the Lasso distribution to draw  # samples from the full conditional distribution of the regression coefficients.    y <- 1:20 X <- matrix(c(1:20,12:31,7:26),20,3,byrow = T)  a1 <- b1 <- u1 <- v1 <- 0.01 sigma2_init <- 1 lambda_init <- 0.1 beta_init <- rep(1, ncol(X)) nsamples <- 1000 verbose <- 100  Output <- Modified_Hans_Gibbs(   X, y, a1, b1, u1, v1,   nsamples, beta_init, lambda_init, sigma2_init, verbose ) #> iter: 0 lambda2: 111.787 sigma2: 135.243 #> iter: 100 lambda2: 10.8956 sigma2: 25.884 #> iter: 200 lambda2: 61.9234 sigma2: 20.4167 #> iter: 300 lambda2: 94.7265 sigma2: 39.2217 #> iter: 400 lambda2: 72.3648 sigma2: 15.074 #> iter: 500 lambda2: 50.5227 sigma2: 15.9175 #> iter: 600 lambda2: 135.66 sigma2: 20.0574 #> iter: 700 lambda2: 38.0999 sigma2: 30.6545 #> iter: 800 lambda2: 2.58036 sigma2: 22.0707 #> iter: 900 lambda2: 25.2982 sigma2: 45.5914  colMeans(Output$mBeta) #> [1]  0.3472431 -0.2546945  0.5260358 mean(Output$vlambda2) #> [1] 70.99966
